revised_title: Morphology and Evolution of Spore-Producing Members in Plants
tldr: This article discusses the morphology and evolution of spore-producing members in plants, focusing on the comparative analysis of various plant types. The author presents a theory of sterilization in the sporophyte and explores the variations in the number of sporangia in vascular plants. The study concludes that the complexity of spore-producing parts in plants can be traced back to modifications of a radial strobiloid type.
